content: Aston Villa are interested in signing Manchester City forward Omar Marmoush. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Indian Woman, 27, Found Dead With Stab Wounds At Ex-Boyfriend's Flat In US: Cops

title: Left Calls For Nationwide Protest Over US Move In Venezuela
content: Five major Left parties have issued a joint statement, strongly condemning what they described as "US aggression" against Venezuela and called for nationwide protests in solidarity with the Latin American nation.

title: Cross-Country Skier Dies In France After 20-Metre Fall
content: A woman died after falling into a hollow in southern France during a cross-country ski excursion, rescue services said Sunday.

title: "Premature At This Point": Marco Rubio On Venezuela Elections
content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio said Sunday that discussions of Venezuela holding elections following Nicolas Maduro's ouster were "premature," with Washington focused on ensuring the remaining leadership in Caracas enacts policy changes.

title: Moscow Airports Shut Amid Ukraine Drone Attacks
content: Three out of four of Moscow's airports shut to air traffic on Sunday after Ukraine launched dozens of drones at the Russian capital, authorities said.

title: 22 Indian Ship Crew Members Arrested In Nigeria With 31.5 Kg Cocaine
content: Nigeria's drug enforcement agency Sunday said it had arrested 22 Indian crew members of a merchant ship after 31.5 kilogrammes of cocaine was found on the vessel at Lagos's main port.

title: US Venezuela Attack¬†Highlights: India Appeals To Address Venezuela Issue "Peacefully Through Dialogue"
content: US Strikes on Venezuela and Captured Maduro Highlights: Vice President Delcy Rodriguez will assume the role of acting president of the country in the absence of Nicolas Maduro.

title: Bangladesh's BNP Thanks PM Modi For Condoling Khaleda Zia's Death
content: Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) appreciated Prime Minister Narendra Modi's condolence message on former prime minister Khaleda Zia's demise while recalling her contribution to India-Bangladesh ties.

title: Punjab AAP Sarpanch Shot In The Head At Amritsar Wedding Hall, Dies
content: A sarpanch from Punjab's ruling Aam Aadmi Party was shot dead at a wedding hall, the Marigold Resort, in Amritsar.

title: Day After Trump's Will "Run" Venezuela Remark, A U-Turn By His Top Aide
content: Secretary of State Marco Rubio suggested Sunday that the United States would not take a day-to-day role in governing Venezuela other than enforcing an existing "oil quarantine" on the country.

title: Coffee Exports Slipping, Your Morning Cup May Taste More Bitter: Here's Why
content: Coffee, the aromatic beloved beverage that fuels millions every morning, is facing an unprecedented challenge. Climate change and global warming are shaking the very roots of coffee plantations worldwide.

title: Large Part Of Maduro's Security Team Killed During US Raid: Venezuela
content: A large part of erstwhile President Nicolas Maduro's security team was killed in the US raid that led to the leader's Saturday capture, Venezuelan Defence Minister General Vladimir Padrino said.

title: Indore Water Crisis: 20 New Diarrhoea Cases Detected, Over 9,000 Screened
content: Twenty new patients were detected in Indore on Sunday after health teams screened over 9,000 persons amid a diarrhoea outbreak caused by contaminated drinking water in the country's cleanest city, officials said.

title: Venezuela Military Recognises Veep Delcy Rodriguez As Acting President
content: Venezuela's military on Sunday recognized Delcy Rodriguez, deputy to ousted president Nicolas Maduro, as the country's acting leader, after US forces extracted the former head of state to face trial.

title: Manipur Woman Stabs South Korean Boyfriend To Death In Greater Noida Flat
content: A South Korean man was allegedly killed by his live-in partner, a woman from Manipur, following an argument in Greater Noida today. The woman has been taken into custody.

title: Indore's Water Crisis That Claimed 16 Lives Enters A Terrifying New Phase
content: Sixteen people have already died in Bhagirathpura after consuming contaminated drinking water in Madhya Pradesh's Indore, officially India's "cleanest city."

title: Leopard Attacks Farmer In Maharashtra, Both Die After Falling In Well: Cops
content: A farmer and a leopard died after the big cat attacked him and then both fell into a well in Nashik's Sinnar taluka on Sunday, a police official said.

title: Let Mohan Bhagwat Define Love Jihad: A Owaisi Demands Data In Parliament
content: Hyderabad MP and AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi questioined today that is love jihad is happening, why no data about it is being presented in parliament.

title: Dalit Woman Stabbed To Death, Accused Found Dead In Karnataka Forest: Cops
content: A 30-year-old Dalit woman was stabbed to death on a road in Uttara Kannada, allegedly by a man known to her, police said.

title: "Have you Seen Their Car?" Elon Musk's Mockery Of Chinese Rival BYD Backfires
content: Over a decade ago, a confident Elon Musk laughed dismissively when asked if Chinese automaker BYD could become a serious competitor to Tesla in the electric vehicle (EV) market.

title: Why Maduro, why now: Inside America's most dramatic move in Latin America in decades
content: Washington crossed a historic line by seizing Venezuela‚Äôs sitting president, ending decades of restraint despite years of sanctions and threats. The US framed the operation as a strike against narco-terrorism, but it was driven by wider aims, including oil, migration, domestic US politics and reasserting dominance in Latin America amid rivalry with China, Russia and Iran.

title: 'Resume normal activity': Venezuela military to citizens; backs VP Delcy as acting prez
content: Venezuela's military has recognized Delcy Rodriguez as acting leader following President Nicolas Maduro's capture by US forces and subsequent indictment on terrorism and drug charges. US Secretary of State Marco Rubio deemed discussions of elections premature, emphasizing policy changes. Maduro and his wife were reportedly taken into custody after pre-dawn attacks on Caracas.

title: ILT20 Final: Third time is a charm! Curran leads Vipers to maiden title
content: Desert Vipers had stood under the Ring of Fire twice before as the runners-up. On Sunday, on their third journey to the ILT20 Final, they ensured the hapless record would come to an end. Sam Curran, the Player of the Match and the winner of both Red and Green Belts, played a captain's knock in making that happen.

title: America will ‚Äòcollapse‚Äô: Elon Musk‚Äôs father warns; cites population shift
content: Errol Musk, father of Tesla CEO Elon Musk, has sparked controversy with remarks predicting a US 'collapse' due to the white population becoming a minority within two decades. He also downplayed systemic oppression in South Africa, claiming white populations significantly contributed to Black African development.

title: 'Great powers don't act like that': Vance pushes back on criticism of Venezuela op
content: US Vice President JD Vance defended the recent military strike against Venezuela, citing the country's alleged involvement in drug trafficking and the use of seized American oil assets to fund "narcoterrorist activities.

title: Confusion, queues, goof-ups mark 2 months of SIR in Bengal
content: Two months into Bengal's electoral roll revision, citizens face confusion and difficulties regaining their voting rights due to document discrepancies and unclear directives. Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has criticized the "unplanned, arbitrary" process, highlighting instances of elderly and infirm voters being summoned for hearings, leading to widespread public outcry.

title: Indore declares Bhagirathpura waterborne outbreak epidemic; calls in special teams to contain spread
content: Indore health officials declared a waterborne disease outbreak in Bhagirathpura an epidemic after 10 deaths. Specialized national and state teams are investigating the contamination source. Narmada water supply remains suspended, with residents instructed on borewell and tank chlorination. Clean water is being supplied via tankers, and affected patients receive free treatment.

title: China's DeepSeek returns: Proves cheaper AI works again; Silicon Valley shaken
content: Chinese AI firm DeepSeek unveiled a groundbreaking training method, "Manifold-Constrained Hyper-Connections," potentially slashing AI development costs. This innovation challenges the notion that advanced AI necessitates massive computing power, following their previous success with the R1 model. The breakthrough intensifies industry debates on scaling AI, with expectations high for DeepSeek's next model release.

title: NHAI flags 424 'telecom black spots', urges TRAI to step in
content: NHAI has identified 424 "telecom black spots" totaling 1,750 km on highways and expressways, urging TRAI to direct operators to improve mobile network coverage. This lack of connectivity hinders emergency communication and highway operations. NHAI also proposed free, proactive SMS alerts for accident-prone zones, including those with stray cattle, to enhance road user safety.

title: ‚ÄòThis is where we live‚Äô: Rubio on Venezuelan oil; warns China, Russia & Iran
content: US secretary of state Marco Rubio stated the US aims to prevent adversaries from controlling Venezuela's oil industry, asserting the Western Hemisphere is America's backyard. He argued foreign involvement destabilizes the region and causes mass migration, vowing this will not continue under President Trump.

title: Warren Buffett's biggest tech regret: Missing Google's IPO; invests after 21 yrs
content: Warren Buffett and the late Charlie Munger finally ended their decades-long regret by acquiring a $4.3 billion stake in Alphabet, Google's parent company, in Q3 2025. This move, driven by firsthand experience of Google's advertising prowess through GEICO, signals Berkshire Hathaway's growing confidence in Alphabet's AI ambitions and its core search business.

title: With MGNREGA agitation, Cong eyes long-term drive
content: Congress plans a long-term sensitization campaign for MGNREGA workers, drawing inspiration from the farm laws stir. Unlike the farmer protests, the current agitation faces challenges mobilizing the poor working class for prolonged struggle. The party aims to educate workers about potential impacts of new policies, acknowledging the battle will be prolonged.

title: Caitlin Clark vs Sophie Cunningham net worth 2025: WNBA earnings and endorsements
content: Sophie Cunningham and Caitlin Clark have constantly proved their worth in the court. The two young players of the Indiana Fever have sparked chaos with their bond and talent. But they have also built a significant net worth that will impress many fans. Both the young players also continue to remain associated with renowned brands that have helped in building a massive net worth.

title: SIR lens on parents of Goans with Portuguese passports
content: Around 30,000 Goans surrendered Indian passports in a decade for foreign nationality, primarily Portuguese. Now, their parents, who registered births in Portugal, face scrutiny from the Election Commission. This action aims to verify electoral roll entries of individuals who acquired foreign passports and citizenship.

title: York family net worth: How a $13M bet turned into the 49ers‚Äô $8.4B empire
content: Forbes ranks San Francisco 49ers owner Denise DeBartolo York and her family at $8.4 Billion, placing them ahead of Donald Trump and Mark Cuban. The York family controls over 90% of the 49ers, now valued above $8 Billion, after decades of growth tied to NFL success and global sports investments, according to Forbes 2025 rankings released in September this year.

title: Taylor Swift reportedly shaken by Travis Kelce‚Äôs controversial confession
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce have been dealing with a lot on their plate ever since they announced their engagement last year. While the two have kept themselves busy with planning their wedding, it seems Taylor Swift is deeply unsettled by some of Travis Kelce's words that he has said in public about his past. It seems this has become a huge deal for Taylor Swift ahead of their wedding.

title: Vanessa Bryant says friends helped her move forward after Kobe‚Äôs Lakers legacy
content: Vanessa Bryant, widow of NBA legend Kobe Bryant, continues to champion the Mamba & Mambacita Sports Foundation. Recently, she shared a striking photo, crediting her friends for encouraging her to be more present in pictures.  She also celebrated Taylor Swift wearing Kobe Bryant merchandise, a gesture her daughters, avid Swifties, would appreciate.

title: ‚ÄòBhrashtachaar Bachao Sangram‚Äô: Shivraj Chouhan hits out at Congress; defends G RAM G
content: Rural Development Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan has labeled Congress's 'MGNREGA Bachao Sangram' as 'Bhrashtachaar Bachao Sangram,' accusing the opposition of spreading misinformation about the new 'Viksit Bharat- Guarantee for Rozgar and Ajeevika Mission (Gramin) Act.

title: Jay Shah says India aims to host 2036 Olympics; hopes Gujarat will contribute 10 medals
content: Speaking at an event in Surat, Shah said Prime Minister Narendra Modi played a key role in bringing the Commonwealth Games to Gujarat.

title: Dharamshala case accused denies ragging; claims prof named in FIR is innocent
content: An accused student in a Himachal Pradesh college ragging and sexual harassment case, where a classmate died, denied all charges in a social media video. She claimed innocence for herself and two other accused students, asserting they were all classmates and belonged to the same Scheduled Caste community.

title: Mustafizur row: B'desh not to travel to India for T20 World Cup; did Yunus govt 'intervene'?
content: The issue was discussed in the backdrop of Bangladesh pacer Mustafizur Rahman‚Äôs exclusion from the Indian Premier League (IPL). BCB directors had earlier held an online meeting on Saturday night to discuss the matter.

title: MLB trade rumors: Phillies eye Realmuto shift as Bichette talks heat up
content: The Phillies are pressing J.T. Realmuto to decide his future while also joining the chase for Bo Bichette. At the same time, the Blue Jays remain active after signing Kazuma Okamoto and are still eyeing Bo Bichette and Kyle Tucker. With many teams involved, the MLB offseason is starting to heat up fast.

title: Gold, silver set for volatile week amid US data, Venezuela crisis; analysts warn of swings
content: Gold and silver prices are poised for volatility this week, driven by crucial US economic data and escalating geopolitical tensions following the reported capture of Venezuela's President Maduro. Analysts anticipate aggressive trading as markets digest the fallout, with potential impacts on bullion and crude oil. Despite recent corrections, underlying safe-haven demand persists.

title: Delhi blast: Probe unveils how terrorists spoke to Pak handlers - What's 'ghost' SIM card?
content: The ‚Äúwhite-collar‚Äù terror module began to unravel on the intervening night of October 18-19, 2025, when posters of the banned Jaish-e-Mohammad (JeM) appeared on walls outside Srinagar city, warning of attacks on police and security forces in the Valley. A large cache of arms and ammunition, including 2,900 kg of ammonium nitrate, potassium nitrate and sulphur, was seized during the operation, officials said.

title: Ayesha Khan reacts as Dhurandhar song Shararat with Krystle hits 100m views
content: 'Dhurandhar' dominates 2025 box office while 'Shararat' with Ayesha Khan and Krystle D'Souza hits 100M YouTube views. Ayesha shared a theater clip, captioning her surreal joy and gratitude to casting director and producer. She vowed to rule with hard work, crediting family and team support.

title: Venezuela oil plan: Trump‚Äôs takeover idea unlikely to shift global prices soon
content: Analysts believe US President Trump's plan to seize Venezuela's oil industry and invite American companies to rebuild it will not immediately impact global oil prices. Years of neglect, mismanagement, and sanctions have severely damaged the sector, requiring significant time and investment for any meaningful production increase. Political stability and contract clarity are crucial hurdles for foreign companies considering substantial investment.

title: Aus coach says 'spin important'; team goes without spinner in Sydney
content: With senior off-spinner Nathan Lyon ruled out because of a hamstring injury, Australia chose not to play a specialist spinner in Sydney. This marked the first time since 1888 that Australia fielded an all-pace attack at the SCG. It was also the third occasion in the ongoing Ashes series that Australia opted for only fast bowlers.

title: 'Rectify the glitches, or ...': CM Mamata writes to CEC; urges to stop 'unplanned' Bengal SIR
content: Mamata Banerjee called the exercise "unplanned, arbitrary and adhoc" and urged the poll body chief to stop the SIR if glitches remain unattainted. In November last year, describing the ongoing SIR in West Bengal as ‚Äúunplanned, chaotic, and dangerous,‚Äù Mamata Banerjee said that the situation had reached an ‚Äúalarming stage‚Äù following the deaths of multiple booth-level officers (BLOs), including an anganwadi worker in Jalpaiguri.

title: 'Safety concerns': What Bangladesh said on not touring India for T20 World Cup
content: The matter was discussed following Bangladesh pacer Mustafizur Rahman‚Äôs exit from the Indian Premier League (IPL). BCB directors had earlier held an online meeting on Saturday night to deliberate on the issue.

title: Retail inflation outlook: CPI likely rises to 1.66% in Dec on food prices
content: As per a  Union Bank of India report, India's retail inflation is projected to rise to 1.66% in December 2025, up from 0.71% in November, driven by increasing food prices. Despite this uptick, inflation is expected to remain significantly below last year's levels. Core inflation, however, is anticipated to climb due to a surge in gold prices.

title: 'Very serious': Why flights were grounded in Greece? Thousands stranded
content: Thousands of travelers were stranded in Greece as flights were grounded for hours due to a unexplained loss of radio frequency. Air traffic controllers reported an inability to communicate with aircrafts, leading to widespread disruptions and delays. There was no immediate clarity on what caused the disruption, which began early Sunday and escalated rapidly

title: 'Will face consequences if guilty': Accused prof on Himachal student death
content: A Dalit student's death sparks protests in Dharamshala, with family alleging ragging and harassment. Accused teacher Ashok Kumar vows cooperation and acceptance of consequences if found guilty. The college principal clarifies the student's academic status, while authorities assure a thorough investigation and strict action against those responsible.

title: Trump says US to 'run' Venezuela, tap its crude: Why it won't matter for India's oil bill
content: US President Donald Trump has said America is taking temporary control of Venezuela, aiming to tap its vast oil reserves. Despite holding the world's largest crude reserves, Venezuela's oil output is unlikely to see a significant boost for years due to political instability and decaying infrastructure. India's exposure remains minimal due to low trade and diversified sourcing.

title: CIA in Caracas, spy near 'rotating' Maduro: The planning behind 'flawless' op Absolute Resolve
content: US special forces, after months of intelligence gathering and rehearsals, executed a pre-dawn raid to capture Venezuelan President Nicol√°s Maduro. The operation, named 'Absolute Resolve,' involved a covert CIA entry, drone surveillance, and detailed military planning, culminating in Maduro's extraction to the United States to face drug trafficking charges.

title: 'Huge problem': Is Cuba next after Venezuela? Here's what Marco Rubio said
content: Following the US operation in Venezuela, Secretary of State Marco Rubio indicated the Cuban government is a "huge problem" and "in a lot of trouble." President Trump also stated Cuba is a "failing nation" and that the US wants to help its people. This comes amid criticism from allies and strong condemnation from Cuba's president regarding the Venezuela action.

title: Marble deals, social posts & Maduro's capture: A Trump holiday like no other
content: President Trump concluded his Florida holiday with a surprise military raid in Venezuela, capturing President Maduro. This dramatic operation unfolded amidst a schedule filled with personal pursuits, including inspecting marble for a White House ballroom and attending social events. The swift action, planned during his break, highlights a stark contrast between his public and private activities.

title: 'Exact opposite': US secretary of war contrasts Venezuela mission with 2003 Iraq war
content: US Secretary of War Pete Hegseth declared Washington's swift operation in Venezuela, capturing President Maduro, a stark contrast to the Iraq invasion. He emphasized no prolonged conflict or American casualties, highlighting strategic action for resource access and national benefit.  President Trump announced plans for US oil companies to rebuild Venezuela's infrastructure, promising peace and prosperity.

title: US grip on Venezuelan oil could help India recover $1bn dues, revive stalled output
content: A US-led takeover of Venezuela's oil sector could significantly benefit India, potentially recovering nearly $1 billion in long-pending payments and reviving crude production from fields operated by Indian firms.  With US sanctions eased, ONGC Videsh Ltd could restart operations at the San Cristobal oilfield, boosting output and allowing for the recovery of dues.

title: India-EU FTA talks: Piyush Goyal to visit Brussels this week; talks enter final phase
content: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal is heading to Brussels for crucial talks on the India-EU free trade agreement, now in its final and most challenging phase. The negotiations aim to bridge gaps on sensitive issues, including the EU's carbon border adjustment mechanism, with both sides pushing for an early conclusion.

title: 'US not at war with Venezuela, but with ...': Marco Rubio after Maduro's capture
content: The United States is targeting drug cartels, not Venezuela, according to Secretary of State Marco Rubio. He confirmed an operation removed President Nicolas Maduro. Rubio expects changes in Venezuela, emphasizing cooperation with drug traffickers is a threat. The US is ready to work with Venezuela's leaders if they make the right decisions, retaining leverage otherwise.

title: Rice production: India overtakes China as top global producer; output hits 150mn tonnes
content: India has become the world's largest rice producer, surpassing China with an output of 150.18 million tonnes. This achievement follows the release of 184 new high-yielding, climate-resilient crop varieties developed by ICAR. The nation is now a global food provider with adequate foodgrain stocks.

title: Bengaluru job fraud: Woman poses as KPCC leader, cheats aspirants of Rs 5.3 crore; booked
content: Bengaluru CCB police have registered a case against Shamshad Begum and her associates for allegedly duping job aspirants of Rs 5.3 crore. Begum, who claimed to be a KPCC Mahila Morcha general secretary, and her father allegedly promised government jobs in various departments in exchange for money, issuing fake appointment letters and admit cards to victims.

title: Tejas @25: IAF chief stresses on need to adhere to delivery timelines
content: Chethan Kumar is a Senior Assistant Editor with the Times of India. Aside from specialising in Space & Science, he has reported extensively on varied topics, with special focus on defence, policy and data stories. He has covered multiple elections, too. As a young democracy grows out of adolescence, Chethan feels, there are reels of tales emerging which need to be captured. To do this, he alternates between the mundane goings-on of the Common Man and the wonder-filled worlds of scientists and scamsters, politicians and soldiers. In a career spanning nearly 18 years, he has reported from multiple datelines ‚Äî Houston, Florida, Kochi, Hyderabad, Chennai, Sriharikota (AP), NH-1 (J&K Highway), New Delhi, Ahmedabad, Raichur, Bhatkal, Mysuru, Chamarajanagar, to name a few ‚Äî  but is based out of Bengaluru, India‚Äôs science capital that also hosts the ISRO HQ. Read More

title: AAP sarpanch gunned down at Amritsar wedding; assailants fire at point-blank range

title: Quarterfinal takeaways: Ole Miss' wild upset, Indiana's dominance, more
content: the second edition of the college football playoff quarterfinals gave us two classics and two statement wins . on Wednesday, no. 10 Miami rode an early 14-0 burst and a clutch late touchdown drive to a 24-14 upset of no. 2 Ohio State . the Hurricanes advanced to the semis to face no. 6 Ole Miss .

title: Testing grit and willpower with 7 marathons, 7 continents in 7 days
content: WOLF's FANG RUNWAY in Antarctica ranks among the most desolate, unwelcoming places on the planet . 54 runners stepped off their charter plane on Nov. 16 and steeled themselves for the 26.2 miles of marathon hell ahead . the race took them in a matter of hours from the lung-freezing cold of Antarctica to the 94-degree heat of Perth, Australia .

title: College football transfer portal: Tracking who's on the move
content: Max Olson ranks Cincinnati's Brendan Sorsby as the top player in the transfer portal and predicts a recruitment battle between Texas Tech and LSU. (1:04) College football's transfer portal officially opened at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. By midday on Day 1, more than 4,500 Division I college football players have entered the transfer portal. Players now have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.

title: NFL Week 18 highlights, big plays and moments
content: Bryce Young and the Panthers can't convert a miracle as a time expires, falling to the Buccaneers 16-14. (0:26) The final week of the NFL regular season features key storylines that will determine playoff berths and positioning. If the  Atlanta Falcons  defeat the  New Orleans Saints , the  Carolina Panthers  become the NFC South champs. Otherwise, the  Tampa Bay Buccaneers  win the division. And Sunday night's game between the  Baltimore Ravens  and  Pittsburgh Steelers  will decide the AFC North champ. The loser is out of the playoffs. This file will be updated throughout the day with the top highlights and most important moments.
